intro: Prosaptia hornei, commonly known as the horned sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves, which are typically green and narrow. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Prosaptia hornei is often found in wet or damp habitats, such as marshes and along stream banks.
